thread.title_full: QR280 Dubai flights from Amritsar, Calicut | International | News | Qatar Day

author: emirates247
title: QR280 Dubai flights from Amritsar, Calicut | International | News | Qatar Day
text:
Emirates and Air Arabia also offering discounted fares to select Indian cities
Giving more options to travellers between Dubai and the Indian cities of Amritsar and the south Indian city of Calicut, Indian budget carrier SpiceJet has announced direct flight between these routes.
These services are scheduled to take off starting November 15, but passengers can start booking their tickets at an introductory fare of Rs4,999 (Dh280) for a one-way fare.
With the launch of these flights, SpiceJet will be serving Dubai direct from eight Indian cities: Delhi, Mumbai, Ahmedabad, Pune, Kochi, Madurai, Amritsar, and Kozhikode, with connections from other cities including Kolkata, Chennai, Hyderabad, and Bengaluru.
 SpiceJetâ€™s is a low-cost Indian airline, catering primarily to destinations within the country but also flies to select international destination with Dubai being one of them.
Locally, Emirates airlines is also giving discount to popular Indian destinations. The carrier has a special featured fare from Dubai to Mumbai for Dh980 for a return flight.
Air Arabia also has a sale running to some of destinations in India. You can fly to Kochi for Dh699, to Ahmedabad, Goa, Mumbai, Nagpur, and Thiruvanathapuram for Dh799 and to Bangalore, Calicut, Chennai, Coimbatore, Delhi, Hyderabad and Jaipur for Dh849.
To avail these special fares you need to book until October 12 for travel until April 30.
Share: Someone You Know Needs to Hear This
